business.headline: Rs 33,000 per device, Rs 3,000 monthly post-trial: Starlink's India entry planStarlink customers will need to purchase a satellite dish-essential hardware for accessing the service-at an estimated cost of Rs 33,000. The monthly unlimited data plan will be offered at Rs 3,000.

Warner Bros Discovery to become two separate companies: ReportThe decision comes as more people stop watching traditional TV and move to streaming platforms. This shift has forced many media companies to rethink how they work.

Your Rs 1 crore flat is now Rs 90 lakh: Investor explains why value is shrinkingA financial influencer warns that unchecked money printing and currency devaluation could be reducing the real value of properties and other assets, urging investments in inflation-resistant assets.

Pakistan's economy set to grow 2.7% in FY25: ReportPakistan's central bank, in a bid to encourage growth, cut its policy rate by more than 1,000 basis points in the current fiscal year. Its latest cut last month brought the key rate to 11%, resuming an easing cycle that had brought rates down from 22% after a brief pause in March.
Sensex settles over 200 points; Nifty above 25,100; Kotak Bank gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 256.22 points to close at 82,445.21, while the NSE Nifty50 added 100.20 points to end at 25,103.20.

Who is Sashidhar Jagdishan? HDFC Bank CEO under financial fraud lensSashidhar Jagdishan has been a part of HDFC Bank since 1996. He joined as a manager in the finance division and quickly rose through the ranks.

Shein, Reliance aim to sell India-made clothes globally within a year: ReportThe aim is to make Shein-branded clothes in India not just for local sales but also for international markets, starting with the US and UK, within the next 6 to 12 months.
Gautam Adani earned Rs 10.41 crore in FY25: Who earned more than him?Gautam Adani earned Rs 10.41 crore in the financial year 2024–25, which is much less than several leading business heads in India.

RBI's bumper rate cut leaves rupee exposed to fresh depreciation riskThe rupee has already lagged behind its Asian peers in 2025, weighed down by tepid capital inflows. Now, with the RBI easing faster than the US Federal Reserve, the narrowing interest rate differential is expected to keep the rupee on the back foot.

HDFC Bank and BoB cut lending rates after RBI repo rate slashBorrowers can expect EMIs on home loans, personal loans, and other credit products to come down slightly, offering a bit of breathing space amid rising living costs.

Income Tax ramps up checks on big transactions with new filing and TDS rulesThe Income Tax Department has ramped up efforts to spot individuals who spend heavily but may be hiding their real income, using data analytics and tighter links with financial institutions.
Currency devaluation is quietly eating into your wealth, expert warnsYour money or assets might look the same in your account, but its real value could be slipping away every year, warns expert.

entertainment.headline: New faces join Harry Potter HBO series: Meet the Malfoys, Dursleys, and moreHBO reveals nine new cast members for its upcoming Harry Potter TV series, promising a faithful adaptation of The Sorcerer's Stone. The series will stream exclusively on Max in multiple countries.

Sly Stone, groundbreaking musician behind 'Family Affair,' dies in Los AngelesSly Stone, iconic frontman of Sly and the Family Stone, died at 82. Known for revolutionizing funk and promoting unity through music, his influence shaped decades of American sound and culture.

Diddy's ex-girlfriend recounts trauma in wake of Cassie's abuse claimsDiddy's ex-girlfriend broke down in court, saying Cassie's abuse lawsuit mirrored her own trauma. She testified about coerced sex, emotional abuse, and threats linked to her housing and relationship with Combs.

Judge dismisses Justin Baldoni's $400 million defamation lawsuit against Blake LivelyA US judge dismissed Justin Baldoni's $650 million lawsuits against Blake Lively, Ryan Reynolds, and others, ruling insufficient evidence of defamation. A separate trial between Baldoni and Lively begins in 2026.

Frederick Forsyth, author of 'The Day of the Jackal, dies at 86Frederick Forsyth, bestselling author of The Day of the Jackal, died at 86. A former RAF pilot and journalist, he secretly aided MI6 and leaves behind a legacy of iconic thrillers.

Akhanda 2 teaser out: Nandamuri Balakrishna's action saga set for September releaseDirected by Boyapati Sreenu, the sequel to the 2021 Telugu blockbuster film 'Akhanda' stars Nandamuri Balakrishna in the lead. Titled 'Akhanda 2: Thaandavam', the film also stars Samyuktha Menon and Aadhi Pinisetty in prominent roles.

Ed Sheeran praises Arijit Singh's Tum Hi Ho in heartfelt post: I was spellboundEnglish singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran recently shared a heartwarming note dedicated to Arijit Singh. Apart from cherishing his experience of scooter rides with Arjit, Ed also praised 'Tum Hi Ho' from 'Aashiqui 2'.

Actor Ravi Mohan's rumoured partner Keneeshaa reacts to pregnancy rumoursActor Ravi Mohan's rumoured partner, Keneeshaa Francis, has reacted to the speculations over her alleged pregnancy. Keneeshaa revealed the truth behind the picture which led to the pregnancy claims.

It's a wrap for Karthi, Malavika Mohanan starrer Sardar 2: What an adventureDirected by PS Mithran, 'Sardar 2' is the sequel to the 2022 blockbuster, with Tamil actor Karthi reprising his dual roles, along with Malavika Mohanan and SJ Suryah. The team recently wrapped the shooting.

Metro In Dino's heartbreak anthem Dil Ka Kya reminds fans of KKAnurag Basu's 'Metro...In Dino' releases its second song, 'Dil Ka Kya' highlighting emotional storytelling. The song reminded fans of the late singer KK

Khushi Kapoor, Vedang Raina steal the spotlight at Sonam Kapoor's birthday bashActors Khushi Kapoor and Vedang Raina were seen engaged in a private conversation at Sonam Kapoor's birthday bash. The dating rumours between the couple started after their debut film, The Archies.'

Asha Negi on Criminal Justice 4, admiring Tabu, Sakshi Tanwar's journeyActor Asha Negi, in an interview with IndiaToday.in, shared her experience of working on 'Criminal Justice 4.' She also spoke about playing the girl-next-door and her admiration for Tabu and Sakshi Tanwar.

Salman-SRK's Tiger vs Pathaan on hold as YRF revamps spy universe: ReportSalman Khan and Shah Rukh Khan's 'Tiger Vs Pathaan' has not been shelved but put on hold as YRF seeks to revamp its spy universe, suggested media reports. The makers are trying to add a fresh direction and innovative storytelling styles to the film.

They decide the date, not us: Kuberaa producer slams OTT's growing control'Kuberaa' producer Suniel Narang revealed that when a July release date was requested, the OTT platform insisted on the original date of June 20, warning that any delay would result in a Rs 10 crore cut from the agreed amount.

Director Manish Gupta denies stabbing driver with knife: How can there be no blood?Director Manish Gupta said in a statement that the driver had made false allegations against him with the intention to extort money. He submitted the CCTV footage asking how the driver could walk as if nothing had happened after claiming to be stabbed with a knife.

Meet Khushi, girl with Asperger's syndrome in Pankaj Tripathi's Criminal Justice 4Actor Khushi Bharadwaj, who began her acting career with 'Balveer', plays the role of Ira Nagpal, a girl living with Asperger's syndrome, in 'Criminal Justice Season 4'. In an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, she talks about maintaining the sensibility of the character, and why the industry needs to be inclusive enough to cast someone living with the same condition to play the role.

20 years on, Sonali Bendre reacts to rumours of Raj Thackeray's crush on herActor Sonali Bendre reacted to reports of MNS (Maharashtra Navnirman Sena) politician Raj Thackerey having a crush on her 20 years ago. The actor said that the reports are not in good taste, since families are involved.

Aamir Khan shares why nephew Imran Khan struggled to fit into BollywoodBollywood superstar Aamir Khan has shared why his nephew Imran Khan did not fit into Bollywood. The actor said Imran was offered mainstream films, but he is not comfortable with 'herogiri'.

Actor Vishnu Manchu reveals dream cast for a pan-India action film | ExclusiveTelugu actor-producer Vishnu Manchu expressed his wish to make pan-Indian action movie featuring top stars from various film industries. In a chat with India Today, he listed his dream cast.

general news.headline: Indian astronaut's launch to Space Station postponed due to bad weatherThe Indian Space & Research Organisation (Isro) on Monday said that the launch has been postponed due to bad weather in the launch area.

700 US Marines land in LA as California sues Trump over guard deploymentThe Pentagon has deployed 700 Marines to Los Angeles to support National Guard troops amid immigration protests. California has sued Trump administration, calling the federal deployment unlawful.

Meghalaya honeymoon murder victim's gold jewellery, wallet missing, reveals FIRMeghalaya honeymoon murder case: After Indore's Sonam Raghuvanshi surrendered in Uttar Pradesh's Ghazipur, an FIR revealed that her husband Raja Raghuvanshi's gold chain, gold engagement ring, gold wedding ring, gold bracelet, and wallet containing cash were all reported missing.

Biological smuggling: US arrests Chinese scientist linked to Wuhan LabChinese Ph.D. student Chengxuan Han was arrested in Detroit for allegedly smuggling roundworm-related biological materials into the US and lying to federal agents, amid growing scrutiny of CCP-linked researchers.

Can Bangladesh trust Yunus's April 2026 poll promise?As murmurs of public support were amplified by Yunus's camp, Bangladesh's interim government finds itself under pressure from political parties and the military to hold elections this year, not delay democracy.

Apple unveils iOS 26 with radical liquid glass design for iPhones at WWDC 2025At its annual Worldwide Developers Conference today, Apple announced the iOS 26 update for iPhones. It has a brand-new design and a slew of upgraded features.

May shut down services if...: Goa doctor berated by minister rejects apologyGoa Health Minister Vishwajit Rane apologised for publicly berating Rudresh Kuttikar, the Chief Medical Officer (CMO) of the Goa Medical College, after he received a complaint that the medic refused to treat an elderly patient.

Russia halts flights at Moscow airports after wave of Ukrainian drone attacksRussia temporarily suspended all flights at four major airports serving Moscow early Tuesday, citing safety concerns as Ukrainian drones targeted the region. Russian agencies said air defence systems destroyed 76 drones in just two hours on Monday.

20 years on, Sonali Bendre reacts to rumours of Raj Thackeray's crush on herActor Sonali Bendre reacted to reports of MNS (Maharashtra Navnirman Sena) politician Raj Thackerey having a crush on her 20 years ago. The actor said that the reports are not in good taste, since families are involved.

Pakistan's debt increased to PKR 76,000 billion, economic survey revealsFinance Minister Muhammad Aurangzeb, who released the Economic Survey 2024-25 Monday, said Pakistan's economy has been on the path to recovery for the last two years, and the process was further stabilised and strengthened in the current fiscal year.

MS Dhoni becomes 11th Indian to be inducted into ICC Hall of FameLegendary MS Dhoni has been named as the latest inductee into the ICC Hall of Fame. Dhoni became the 11th Indian cricketer to be named in the list.

Trapped in tight spot, Yunus govt bans rallies in Dhaka's power centreThe interim government of Bangladesh has imposed a sweeping ban on rallies and protests in Dhaka's power centre, which includes the residence of Muhammad Yunus and the Secretariat, a site where civil servants have been protesting for weeks. The ban comes even as the Yunus regime faces mounting protests from government officials, teachers, and pushback from the BNP and the army.

Bengaluru stampede: Celebration without control, accountability without actionThe chaos in Bengaluru during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's (RCB) IPL victory parade stands as a stark reminder of the consequences of administrative complacency.

How Elon Musk is responding to LA riots amid feud with Donald TrumpElon Musk backed Trump's decision to deploy the National Guard amid LA riots, despite their recent feud over the "Big Beautiful Bill," calling the protests violent and reposting anti-riot messages on X.

Watch: Riots erupt in Ireland after alleged sexual assault of girlUnrest broke out in Ballymena, Northern Ireland, after two 14-year-old Romanian boys appeared in court for attempted rape. Social media footage captured plumes of fire near residential buildings, with police present at the scene.

Man who filed case against influencer Sharmishta Panoli arrested in KolkataWajahat Khan, who had allegedly been on the run since June 1, was arrested following a series of raids after multiple summons were ignored.
The Silent Ascent: How Lal Bahadur Shastri became India's Prime MinisterOn this day in 1964, Kamaraj's deft manoeuvring secured Lal Bahadur Shastri's rise amid a fierce succession battle.

I would do it: Trump backs arrest of Newsom amid LA Guard deployment lawsuitPresident Trump said he supports arresting California Governor Gavin Newsom after the state sued over the deployment of 2,000 National Guard troops to LA without approval. California officials, led by Attorney General Rob Bonta, say Trump violated federal law and worsened tensions during immigration protests.

Gaza-bound boat with Greta Thunberg on board arrives in Israel after its seizureGreta Thunberg and other activists tried to bring aid to Gaza but were stopped by Israeli forces and taken to a port in Israel. The activists were held, and their aid was taken away. Rights groups say this was unfair and illegal.

Judge dismisses Justin Baldoni's $400 million defamation lawsuit against Blake LivelyA US judge dismissed Justin Baldoni's $650 million lawsuits against Blake Lively, Ryan Reynolds, and others, ruling insufficient evidence of defamation. A separate trial between Baldoni and Lively begins in 2026.

Video: Australian journalist at LA protests shot by police with rubber bulletLauren Tomasi, US correspondent for Nine News, was covering demonstrations against immigration raids near the Metropolitan Detention Centre in downtown LA when she was struck with a rubber bullet.

Trump says he won't scrap Starlink, wishes Musk well despite tensionsPresident Trump said he has no plans to cancel Elon Musk's Starlink service, calling it 'a good service.' He added he hasn't thought about speaking to Musk but wishes him well.

Odisha IAS officer caught accepting Rs 10 lakh bribe, half of amount demandedIAS officer Chakma, posted in Odisha's Kalahandhi, allegedly threatened a local businessman to pay Rs 20 lakh as bribe, a part of which he was caught accepting by the state vigilance department.

Rs 33,000 per device, Rs 3,000 monthly post-trial: Starlink's India entry planStarlink customers will need to purchase a satellite dish-essential hardware for accessing the service-at an estimated cost of Rs 33,000. The monthly unlimited data plan will be offered at Rs 3,000.

sports.headline: At 29, West Indies star Nicholas Pooran announces shock retirementWest Indies batter Nicholas Pooran announced his retirement from international cricket at 29. His decision reflects a growing trend of players prioritising lucrative T20 leagues over national duty.

Anderson relishing huge honour as England vs India Test series gets renamedThe England-India Test series will now reportedly be named as the Tendulkar-Anderson Trophy. Legendary past bowler James Anderson reacted to the development ahead of the series.

What happens if WTC final is drawn, tied or washed out?South Africa and Australia will compete in the 2025 World Test Championship final at Lord's. What happens in case the match is drawn or gets washed out.

Tanush Kotian flexes batting muscles as India A draw England LionsTanush Kotian and Anshul Kamboj played two big innings on the final day of the 2nd unofficial Test match in Northampton. The match highlighted strong batting performances but ended without a result, setting the tone for the upcoming series.

MS Dhoni becomes 11th Indian to be inducted into ICC Hall of FameLegendary MS Dhoni has been named as the latest inductee into the ICC Hall of Fame. Dhoni became the 11th Indian cricketer to be named in the list.

WTC Final 2025: Live streaming, timing, venue, squad detailsSouth Africa will face Australia in the highly anticipated 2025 World Test Championship final at Lord's. Here's everything you need to know about the match, which starts from June 11.

Steve Smith suggests WTC final tweak, excited to face worthy rivals South AfricaSpeaking to the press two days ahead of the much-anticipated World Test Championship final, Steve Smith talked up the firepower in the South African side and said he had no doubt they deserved to be in the final. Australia are bidding to become the first team to defend the Test championship crown.

South Africa banking on English support in WTC final vs Australia: ConradSouth Africa head into the World Test Championship 2025 final with quiet confidence, said coach Shukri Conrad ahead of the summit clash. The coach has hoped that the local crowd will support them over the Australian team.

All-time classics: Alcaraz vs Sinner and 5 other epic Grand Slam finalsCarlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner waged a war of attrition on the red clay of Paris, battling for five hours and 29 minutes in an unforgettable French Open final on Sunday, June 8. Here are five other major finals from the golden era of Federer, Nadal, and Djokovic that continue to stand the test of time.

WTC final should be hosted by winners of previous edition: Pat CumminsAustralia captain Pat Cummins has proposed that World Test Championship final should be held in the previous winner's country. The summit clash has been hosted in England since the start of the competition.

TNPL: R Ashwin slammed for arguing with umpire, storming off the field in angerTNPL 2025: R Ashwin drew criticism for his outburst at an on-field umpire after being given out LBW. His side, Dindigul Dragons, went on to lose to iDream Tiruppur Tamizhans on Sunday.

Steve Smith suggests WTC final tweak, excited to face worthy rivals South AfricaSpeaking to the press two days ahead of the much-anticipated World Test Championship final, Steve Smith talked up the firepower in the South African side and said he had no doubt they deserved to be in the final. Australia are bidding to become the first team to defend the Test championship crown.

South Africa banking on English support in WTC final vs Australia: ConradSouth Africa head into the World Test Championship 2025 final with quiet confidence, said coach Shukri Conrad ahead of the summit clash. The coach has hoped that the local crowd will support them over the Australian team.

All-time classics: Alcaraz vs Sinner and 5 other epic Grand Slam finalsCarlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner waged a war of attrition on the red clay of Paris, battling for five hours and 29 minutes in an unforgettable French Open final on Sunday, June 8. Here are five other major finals from the golden era of Federer, Nadal, and Djokovic that continue to stand the test of time.

WTC final should be hosted by winners of previous edition: Pat CumminsAustralia captain Pat Cummins has proposed that World Test Championship final should be held in the previous winner's country. The summit clash has been hosted in England since the start of the competition.

TNPL: R Ashwin slammed for arguing with umpire, storming off the field in angerTNPL 2025: R Ashwin drew criticism for his outburst at an on-field umpire after being given out LBW. His side, Dindigul Dragons, went on to lose to iDream Tiruppur Tamizhans on Sunday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
